page.title: 20St.Boswells Fair.
page.content: The annual St.Boswells Fair dates back to 1784 and has traditionally taken place on the village green on the 18th. July. It used to be a horse fair and attracted gypsies from as far away as Ireland and the North of Scotland.The gypsies trade with each other as well as the locals and although the horses have now gone gypsies still come to the fair to keep the traditions alive. Recent years however have seen a substantial decline in the size of the event and 1985 in particular saw the smallest number of caravans ever on the green. Among the reasons suggested for this decline are the fact that the gypsies are now moved on after only two days on the green, and the trend among younger gypsies to live in normal houses in the winter,with a resultant weakening of tradition.
